findOut.title: Find Out
findOut.subtitle: Learn about preventing harassment and how to stay safe

whatIsHarassment.title: What is Harassment?
whatIsHarassment.description: Harassment is any unwanted behavior that makes someone feel uncomfortable, scared, or hurt. It can be physical, verbal, social, or happen online.

typesOfHarassment.title: Types of Harassment
typesOfHarassment.physicalDesc: Hitting, pushing, or touching someone without permission
typesOfHarassment.socialDesc: Excluding someone, spreading rumors, or ignoring them
typesOfHarassment.cyberDesc: Mean messages, sharing photos without permission, or online bullying

howToStaySafe.title: How to Stay Safe
howToStaySafe.advice1: Stay with friends or trusted adults when possible
howToStaySafe.advice2: Tell a teacher, parent, or trusted adult if something happens
howToStaySafe.advice3: Remember: It's never your fault if someone harasses you
howToStaySafe.advice4: Use this platform to report incidents safely and anonymously
howToStaySafe.advice5: Be kind to others and stand up for those who need help

whatToDoIfYouSeeHarassment.title: What to Do If You See Harassment

step1.title: Stay Safe
step1.description: Don't put yourself in danger. Get help from an adult if needed.

step2.title: Report It
step2.description: Use the "Help someone in need" option to report what you saw.

step3.title: Be Supportive
step3.description: Offer kind words and support to the person who was harassed.
